intro: Selinum meum, commonly known as hemlock weed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. It is an annual or biennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Due to its toxic nature, it should be handled with care.
